results.title: What is solarpunk?
results.brief_description: This viral TikTok video is one of the best crash courses on solarpunk out there. Clocking over 2M views, 453.9K likes, and 1,996 comments, it explains the hopeful, rebellious aesthetic blending futuristic tech with eco-friendly values. The “punk” fights capitalism and consumerism, while “solar” is both renewable energy and a metaphorical light in cyberpunk’s dystopian shadow. With clips from Studio Ghibli, the game Solarpunk, and Chobani’s Dear Alice ad, it nails the vibe, even if true solarpunk ideals go deeper. Part of a growing trend of low-cost, high-impact explainer videos, it shows how big ideas can thrive on small screens.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

This viral TikTok video is a crash course on solarpunk. Clocking over 2M views, 453.9K likes and 1,996 comments, it explains the hopeful, rebellious aesthetic that blends futuristic tech with eco-friendly values. The “punk” fights capitalism and consumerism, while “solar” is both renewable energy and a metaphorical light in cyberpunk’s dystopian shadow. By demonstrating the sub-genre through clips from Studio Ghibli, the game Solarpunk, and Chobani’s ‘Dear Alice’ ad, it stands out as an explainer video, a growing trend of low-cost, high-impact videos that show how small screens spread big ideas.

Learn more about solarpunk in The Future & Other Fictions.

By demonstrating the sub-genre through clips from Studio Ghibli, the game Solarpunk, and Chobani’s ‘Dear Alice’ ad, it stands out as an explainer video, a growing trend of low-cost, high-impact videos that show how small screens spread big ideas.

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 74, December 1999
results.creator_credit: Eliot Fish, Jim Flynn and Next Publishing
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-074

results.title: The Silver Brumby: Bravery in the Bush
results.brief_description: From the classic Australian feature film, videos and TV series based on the much loved novels by Elyne Mitchell comes this new CD ROM. Untamed by man and unbroken in spirit, the Silver Brumby captures all the drama and spirit of Australian animals in their natural habitat, while teaching children about the importance of protecting our wildlife and assisting reading and comprehension skills. This CD ROM features 20 beautifully illustrated storybook pages, with several alternate conclusions, as well as 8 fun and challenging puzzles to solve. Suitable for ages 3-8.

results.title: The Exorcist
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, William Peter Blatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Exorcist occupies a central position in the history of horror films, an almost sadistically malevolent experience in terror. Regan (Linda Blair) is a young girl entering puberty and she becomes possessed by the spirit of an ancient demon. Her mother (Ellen Burstyn) finds that there is no assistance in the scientific pragmatism of the modern world and she hesitantly turns to the occult rites of Catholicism and Orthodoxy in order to rid her daughter of the monster. The exorcism scenes attain a disturbing authenticity and they are based on the official Catholic Church rites of exorcism. “The Exorcist” is a film that feeds on our most intimate fears and terrors and not a film for the easily frightened. Stars Max Van Sydow as Father Merrin. Based on the book by William Peter Blatty. Mercedes McCambridge is the voice of the Devil. Part of Tubular Bell by Mike Oldfield used on the soundtrack.

results.title: Lykke Li: Sadness is a Blessing

constellations_other.name: Weaving a dark web
constellations_other.description:
In contemporary Hollywood cinema, children's films often align with comedy and musical genres. However, harking back to the days of European fairytales (and certainly beyond), children's stories are historically dark in tone and were written for both children and adult audiences alike. 
With an apocalyptic threat looming large, Moomins and the Comet Chase veers more into darker territory. However, it is the talented voice cast that conjures some connections to some pure cinema darkness.

results.title: Rihanna: Bitch Better Have My Money

constellations_other.name: Dystopian futures & horrific pasts
constellations_other.description: For an industry that leans strongly toward happy endings, it's interesting to note that a lot of futures that are speculated in film are dystopic.  However we don't need to look too far to find horrors in the past and present.

results.title: Tank girl
results.creator_credit: Rachel Talalay, John Watson, Pen Densham, Richard Lewis, Trilogy Entertainment Group and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The year is 2033 and water is a precious commodity. In the desolate wind swept plains, animals are banned, bathing is unheard of, and the Water & Power Company, headed by the villainous Kesslee (Malcolm McDowell), have ultimate control over the precious H20. One rebel girl stands in their way, Rebecca (Lori Petty), a chick with attitude and an outrageous hairstyle. She is captured by Water & Power when they kill her boyfriend, kidnap her young friend, and try to blackmail her into joining their team. As a prisoner Rebecca discovers a new passion- tanks, and makes a friend with mechanic and pilot, Jet Girl (Naomi Watts), who helps her escape. Once free the girls join forces with The Rippers, an army of half men and half kangaroos, genetically modified to be the ultimate fighting machines. Together they take Water & Power head on, lead by Jet Girl in the sky, and tank girl on the ground with her beloved tank in a flurry of live action and comic strip visuals. Cast also includes Ice-T, Don Harvey and Jeff Kober.

constellations_other.name: Outliers of the Hollywood musical
constellations_other.description: It might feel like the musical genre has been resting since the golden age of cinema, but you only need to look at how many music videos have been produced - especially since the launch of MTV in 1981 - to realise that it isn't. These days, if we count narrative-based music videos, the overwhelming majority that are made are short, snappy and live outside of the Hollywood studio system.

results.title: The Red balloon = Le Ballon rouge
results.brief_description: A small boy finds a balloon which follows him everywhere and fills his need for friendship. When the balloon ultimately lifts the child to the sky, it’s a liberating expression of the freedom of childhood. Based on the story by Albert Lamorisse. No dialogue. (Awards: Academy Award, Best Original Screenplay; Cannes, Best Short Film)
